title: Social and Emotional Development – Student Interpersonal Skills
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

86530C15C3704ADC98A51B80CC698407.description: Respect another’s attempts to complete tasks independently .

F21126FBB53D4B79ABE5F19798265CEE.description: Recognize when someone needs help and offer assistance .

125BF2B3FAB24AABA4AE72D84BF00836.description: Respond with empathy to others who are upset .

1DCD212D1A164A5ABD1259F1261FEC68.description: Actively engage in assisting others when appropriate.

9B1CAF7A6F9C4C2CA982F966868E0654.description: Follow rules and routines in classroom and other settings with reminders .

E77942ED7F414C438AEEFB72241A3460.description: Adjust to changes in routines and activities .

9A6C9C6C03974124B92AEF015C317BB8.description: Apply classroom rules to new situations .

FC79A7296F6A4782BCD91CA1CCDA7423.description: Cooperate in both large and small group activities that are facilitated by adult .

B9533427A920403293717389A1383D22.description: Use inside voices while indoors and outside voices when outdoors .

6B82A966C87C46EBB41BA5EF7162CD61.description: Make transitions between places and people with minimal distress .

8DFBA82B3D9748FB8AE4D987DF4297A5.description: Recognize there are socially acceptable ways to behave in different places.

32C4CEB0D313402487CA9A822B900F6D.description: Discuss the reasons for having rules

C8B091C873154D6C83EB7602E27E79CE.description: Encourage two friends who are having a dispute to “use their words and work it out .”

D2A9C62FC39D4667A6ECAA430B07D322.description: Warn a peer about a safety risk on the playground .

3DCBC05B3BF24B86A12FE6AFA4102E5F.description: Tell a peer when a rule is broken .

EA4F4891DD6841959809EEFBB02E1315.description: Recognize unsafe situations and tell an adult .

80043E7CFF49469CACA96071AA58A621.description: Respond appropriately to offers of help (e .g ., “That’s okay, I can do it .” or “Yes, thank you .”) .

833147AADE424F79875AD4B628B0B9AF.description: Ask for adult help to solve a problem or to complete a task .

636D5EE4C57C483CA0FAF446E92C5F73.description: Recognize appropriate sources of help (e .g ., familiar adult, community helpers, peers) .

B45B76221C20423B8287A5D5CBCB3B6A.description: Attempt tasks independently before asking for help .

8F3D1974B6A348269948D1E8B5250395.description: Ask for and accept offers of help when needed or appropriate.

0D4486923FB949F9985B2B5EB453BF2B.description: Accept and attempt teacher’s or others’ ideas about new strategies to solve a conflict .

B802D20EB80C4C3C98D33F2D075B9C4D.description: Use words during a conflict instead of physically responding .

D816A9FACDFB4CA6A9C7B2C20AF6D6C1.description: Begin to negotiate conflicts that arise using words before seeking help .

11497F32948048A894F795CFF0543849.description: Solve simple conflicts with peers with independence (e .g ., share, take turns, apologize, try something else, ask for help) .

D82320BA6D4842E69DC054BE6026C01B.description: Identify a problem and discuss possible solutions .

80A520ABBF6F4680978FFFBB4339A7CB.description: Use appropriate words and actions to express one’s own desires .

79314CF59A6847D1948CD881DD459A1B.description: Respond to questions posed by adults and peers .

CFF47BF3873649A18D2D504CBFE9A433.description: Pose questions related to topic being discussed .

0E317B20530E4818A090B6B429A74973.description: Communicate using detail related to topic being discussed including topics of personal interest, and special events .

B52F995CB5744CEDA7849444EF41EC2E.description: Engage in reciprocal communication with adults and peers.

99623DAC32FA4E92B8FBEDB1A757613F.description: Demonstrate respect for children’s differences, including differences in thoughts and feelings .

7D0BC4B9BF7644F0AD7D6E7393F6EA2F.description: Understand that the thoughts and feelings of others may differ from own .

FC02614A46764BCBA255C359B48D69FC.description: Understand that family structures may differ from one family to another .

3360684E77474C1EB03B1F49C6980B98.description: Discuss the similarities and differences between self and others .

3969CF7D7AE04A789DAA50B219375455.description: Make drawings of people, including self- portraits, depicting body parts, clothing, and other physical characteristics .

637EB68E34CF4485970A029450EAF00C.description: Understand that each person has a set of unique characteristics .

EF56704B24E742B68622EC353E2D6FE9.description:
Identify similarities and differences
between self and others.

450EF40BC2F0404AB1999CB36A381870.description: Respect feelings and belongings of others .

BC8850E0FF0240088E9EA66E28670064.description: Respond with empathy to others who are upset .

ABC2F2A9DC994FB0BCC5606A9F5A426F.description: Play cooperatively with a few peers for a sustained period of time .

A6F7E1ED3D964BCF97050806E0A7B70F.description: Ask a child to play (e .g ., “Do you want to make a block house with me?”) .

8F7A6E27FF85477BA80571EFDB6E9AF4.description: Seek out companionship from another child .

2EFB10A2670E4A39B973702716EDDD75.description: Demonstrate appropriate affection for familiar adults and peers .

0B6FD2C7D0964F2FB8486A141B735215.description: Respond to familiar adult’s questions and directions .

F1A35431FD344FDF9CEFB5C241094304.description: Engage in reciprocal conversation with familiar peers and adults .

20935008163A494983F01D1407899336.description: Interact with peers and adults in a socially acceptable manner.

DB7AC0343B8243AEB22D1FA505961AD7.description: Set and discuss goals for play and activities when asked .

58B60F3A92AD4DACAAA4EF4575893670.description: Establish goals independently and recognize their influence on choices.

952854850A154755AAAF5CC5A9243141.description: Ask for help with a task after an unsuccessful attempt .

3F8564A6114E4DD0A8139A404332A738.description: Move forward with a second attempt at something after the first attempt was unsuccessful .

C6D0F7F2487B40D3A3C0A341A02FE09D.description: Stay calm when something does not go the way intended .

499B57563B1C446E9453CC893BFE63BD.description:
Recognize that everyone makes mistakes and that using positive coping skills
can result in learning from the experience.

5DAE56FD12484DAF8494B3574AB51514.description: Choose materials and activities based on preferences and personal interests .

D9482A09EF3F49F7B205D8420C5F883A.description: Demonstrate confidence in own abilities (e .g ., “I can kick that ball really far .”) .

29CF5EC0D0A443768EA8C92F4FBA3444.description: Know and state independent thoughts and feelings .

04C223B3B53E4506B85A8A86829A5F7F.description: Demonstrate awareness of self and one’s own preferences .

C089EED714B742E7B2DE1DEAA750F08A.description: Recognize that everyone has personal traits which guide behavior and choices.

F564A67B010F4E0A8DD3670D04A1D256.description: INFLUENCES OF PERSONAL TRAITS ON LIFE

D8B7F7D318C7439C8FE1E8AF4F351802.description: Control negative responses by expressing them in appropriate ways (e .g ., talking with a peer or telling a teacher) .

5B5BE75F4F664C7589FD80132D25FBD9.description: Name a range of feelings (e .g ., excited, scared, angry, surprised) .

06FFC07209B84C7485EF8FE2B3B30494.description: Express feelings verbally or through play and artistic representation .

BC81B2FA7E7B49409D8DCB4E5BA88DB9.description: Express feelings that are appropriate to the situation .

F53D4AF06569432E8F4DC30B479DCCAB.description: Distinguish between emotions and identify socially accepted ways to express them.
